channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16110] AsyncFS WAL doesn't work with Hadoop 2.8+
item.description: The async wal implementation doesn't work with Hadoop 2.8+. Fails compilation and will fail running.
item.summary: AsyncFS WAL doesn't work with Hadoop 2.8+

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
First issue:

The IA.Private DFSClient.Conf class was removed in HDFS-8100. This causes compilation against version 2.8.0-SNAPSHOT+ to fail. If we compile against an earlier release and then run in a cluster running 2.8+ versions, the static initializer in FanOutOneBlockAsyncDFSOutputHelper that sets CREATE_CHECKSUM will throw a ClassNotFoundException and bring down the RS.
I'm going through getting this to work slowly, but if someone else wants to take over that's great by me so I'm not assigning to myself.
It would be useful to know if this could be restricted to working with fewer versions of Hadoop, btw. Barring a discussion on dev@ I'm going to work against 2.4+.

Second issue:

o.a.h.hdfs.server.common.HdfsServerConstants.READ_TIMEOUT was moved by HDFS-8803 to o.a.h.hdfs.protocol.HdfsConstants

Yeah it does not work. Need some changes. Is hadoop 2.8.0 out? Or is there a final due date?

Thanks.

No, it's not out. It's been "coming soon" since like November of last year. These same changes are in Hadoop 3, however, and that's supposed to have alphas in a month or two.

I've run into this while working on updating HADOOP-11804 for current hbase master. I think I'll have all of these things worked out ~Tuesday.

And for hadoop 3, stack and I are trying to push AsyncFSOutput related code into H3. No big progress yet... But seems the endless quarrel on AsyncFS API has ended finally. Will continue tracking it and prepare a patch at the right time.

Thanks.

Sean Busbey Can we have a pre-commit which builds against hadoop-2.8?

Thanks.

-1 overall

If Hadoop publishes SNAPSHOT jars then we can build against branch-2.8 by adding 2.8.0-SNAPSHOT to our list of Hadoop versions.
I have more feedback on the patch but am on mobile. Will post tonight.
a review board link would help, yes. I'd also like to make sure we document here which upstream changes in Hadoop caused our various breakages.
sorry, missed the review board link in the JIRA outage yesterday. I'll work through things later today.
